Posts.Content: LauraOntario wrote: I just did a test on the internet that tells you how long your life span will be according to your personality.  Mine came out to be 102.  I know it's dark humor, but I hope it can give some of you a chuckle. Dx 4/18/2011, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Life Span LauraOntario sandilee

Posts.Content: LauraOntario wrote: I have bone mets to my back and I am experiencing increasing pain in my back.  I see my radiation oncologist on November 9.  I was just wondering if this means I am getting closer to the end? Dx 4/18/2011, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bone pain LauraOntario bhd1

Posts.Content: LauraOntario wrote: Hi there, I've had a problem that has gotten progressively worse over the past month.  I feel sick to my stomach when I eat and then I throw it up.  My oncologist thought I had a bowel obstruction and admitted me to hospital a week ago.  When I went into the hospital I couldn't even hold water down.  They gave me an ex-ray and a CT scan and it showed that I was only partially obstructied.  The thing is, I still can't keep anything down except liquids.  Has anyone else had a problem like this?  Thanks. Dx 4/18/2011, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Vomiting LauraOntario AmyQ

Posts.Content: LauraOntario wrote: I've been taking pamedronate for almost a year now.  I'm just curious if anyone had fractures while on it.  Also how long is it usually administered?  Thanks. Dx 4/18/2011, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anybody on Aredia (pamidronate)? LauraOntario china

Posts.Content: LauraOntario wrote: Hi there,  I thought for a long time that I had lyphedema.  I've had swelling in my legs, hands, and face.  I saw a specialist on Friday and she said that I do have it.  What she told me surprised me, though.  I thought it was because the lymph was not draining, but it turns out it's a chronic condition caused by damage done through cancer treatment.   There's no pill for what I have or anything.  I have to do exercises every day to get the blood moving in my legs and I have to wear compression stockings to get the swelling down in my legs.  The only thing is, they say I'll need help every morning to get the stockings on.  I don't know if I really want that.  Do you think I should just tell them to leave it alone? Thanks, Laura Dx 4/18/2011, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I do have Lymphedema LauraOntario peaches12

Posts.Content: LauraOntario wrote: I have breast cancer with mets to the bone.  I have a blood clot in my right leg and I have to get a needle in my stomach every day.  I have lymphedema.  I have a sore arm.  Then last night I found out I had a bladder infection.  Such a small thing compared to everything else, but it just made me feel like screaming.  Oh well, I have to focus on all the good care I've had.  And the fact that mets to the bone aren't as bad as mets to other places.   Dx 4/18/2011, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: One thing after another. LauraOntario Zillsnot4me
